New Records: Jackson Chourio hit his 17th home run of the season.
Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the ninth inning.
Blake Perkins robbed Noelvi Marte of a potential go-ahead homer with a terrific leaping grab in the sixth.
Jake Bauers made a diving stop of Ty France's hard grounder for the final out.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy said 'We're not saying we're more talented than other teams, we're just finding a way with somebody different every night.'
Post-Match Reflections: Reds manager David Bell said 'The Brewers did what they had to do tonight, great plays, great swings, and good pitching. They're good.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers became the third team to reach 80 wins this season, joining the Dodgers and Phillies.
Milwaukee jumped in front on Willy Adames' three-run drive off Buck Farmer in the third inning.
Others: Reds INF/OF Santiago Espinal was out of the lineup after fouling a ball off his left shin in the second game of Friday's doubleheader.
Brewers RHP Nick Mears (right forearm inflammation) is expected to resume playing catch when the Brewers return home next week.
